import React, { Component } from 'react' import axios from 'axios' export class Register extends Component{ state = { email: '', message: '' } handleChange = (e) => { this.setState({ [e.target.id] : e.target.value }) } handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault() if(this.state.email!==""){ const userInfo = { email: this.state.email } axios.post(`/api/`, userInfo) .then(res => { this.setState({ message : res.data.message }) }) } } render(){ return(

Email Verification

Login

{ (this.state.message === '') ?
:
{this.state.message}
}

About This Program

Description:

This program simulates the process of verifying newly registered accounts through the use of emails.

Process:
  1. The user submits their email address into the form above.
  2. The email is sent to the back-end through an HTTP request using Axios.
  3. The back-end takes the email and checks to see if the email exists in the MongoDB database.
    • If the email does not exist in the database, the user will be sent a verification email.
    • If the email already exists in the database, but is not verified the user will be sent a verification email. Otherwise, the user will be informed that the email is already verified.
  4. The user will receive an email with the verification link and upon submission of the link the user's email will then be verified and completely registered into the database.
Components:

ReactJS, MaterializeCSS, GO, MongoDB(mLab)

) } } export default Register
